title: Searching for Meaning in the Life of Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf: A Call to Meaningful Responses to Tragedies - PMC

quotes: the Economic Times (2010) described her as Liberia's best-ever president.
This study aimed to investigate how Johnson-Sirleaf pursued meaning within the first 68 years of her life.
Liberia is a small West African coastal country founded in 1822 as a settlement area for returning enslaved people.
Liberia experienced one of the bloodiest civil conflicts in African history, in the form of two civil wars, the first between 1989-1996 and the second between 1999-2003.
Liberia experienced one of the bloodiest civil conflicts in African history, in the form of two civil wars, the first between 1989-1996 and the second between 1999-2003.
Liberia held presidential elections in 1996 in which Taylor defeated Johnson-Sirleaf.
In 2003, Liberia was named one of the world’s worst places, characterised by ‘warfare, banditry, disease, land mines and violence’.

Liberia is a small West African coastal country founded in 1822 as a settlement area for returning enslaved people (their descendants are generally known as Americo-Liberians) from the United States of America.

assembled_events.notes: While the quote indicates Johnson-Sirleaf was a candidate for president, it does not confirm she held the position. However, based on the context and her later recognition as Liberia's best-ever president, it is assumed she held the position at some point.
